H0.text: Destroy microbes is the action performed by chemicals produced by specialized cells that protect humans from some infections.

H1.text: Recycle nutrients are chemicals produced by specialized cells that help protect humans from some infections.

H2.text: Allow locomotion is the property of the chemicals produced by specialized cells that protect humans from some infections.

H3.text: Coordinate movement is the action of chemicals produced by specialized cells that protect humans from some infections.

A4.text: beta-lysine, a protein produced by platelets during coagulation, can cause lysis of many Gram-positive bacteria by acting as a cationic detergent.

A5.text: Histamine dilates blood vessels, causing the characteristic signs of inflammation, and recruits neutrophils and macrophages.

A6.text: Neutrophils have three methods for directly attacking microorganisms: phagocytosis (ingestion), degranulation (release of soluble anti-microbials), and generation of neutrophil extracellular traps (NETs).

A7.text: Some bacterial pathogens evolved various mechanisms such as virulence molecules to avoid being killed by neutrophils.

A8.text: Macrophages have evolved defense mechanisms such as induction of nitric oxide and reactive oxygen intermediates, which are toxic to microbes.

A9.text: Macrophages have also evolved the ability to restrict the microbe's nutrient supply and induce autophagy.
